section.section: The board may amend the articles of incorporation only if the members approve the amendment.
Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the board may amend the bylaws without approval of the members.

text.section:
At any meeting of the members, the members may amend the articles of incorporation or, may approve an amendment to the bylaws as provided in subsection (a)(2)(ii) of this section, if:
The notice of the meeting specifies the amendment to be considered; and
Two-thirds of the members present vote for the amendment.

section.section:
An amendment to the articles of incorporation does not become effective until:
The amendment is approved by the Commissioner in writing no later than 60 days after the date of submission of the proposed amendment, unless the Commissioner and the credit union agree to a longer period of time; and
A copy of the amendment certified by the Commissioner is filed with the State Department of Assessments and Taxation.

Whether approved only by the board or by the members as required under subsection (a)(2)(ii) of this section, an amendment to the bylaws does not become effective until the amendment is approved by the Commissioner in writing no later than 60 days after the date of submission of the proposed amendment, unless the Commissioner and the credit union agree to a longer period of time.

text.section: The board shall report an amendment to the members of the credit union no later than the next meeting of the members after the Commissioner approves the amendment.
